transcript.speaker: Abhi
transcript.content: Hi, this is Abhi from RiverLine Bank. Am I speaking with Vasu?

transcript.speaker: Abhi
transcript.content: Vasu, is that correct? This is Abhi, a collections agent from RiverLine Bank, and I'm here to discuss an outstanding balance.

transcript.speaker: Vasu
transcript.content: I know about that. The the thing is I lost my job recently.

transcript.speaker: Vasu
transcript.content: From that, like, I have medical bills, like,

transcript.speaker: Vasu
transcript.content: just piling up above me because of my deteriorating health. So I'm unable to pay the

transcript.speaker: Abhi
transcript.content: I see. Vasu, I understand that's a difficult situation. However, the outstanding debt of $150 from our records needs to be addressed. Can you tell me when you expect to be able to make a payment?

transcript.speaker: Vasu
transcript.content: The thing is I don't have any source of income as of now. Apart from that, I also all of my things are gone.

transcript.speaker: Vasu
transcript.content: So the best that I can do is a ten dollar per month.

transcript.speaker: Abhi
transcript.content: Hmm, Vasu, I want to make sure we can come to a mutually agreeable plan. A $10 monthly payment might not cover the debt in a timely manner, considering the interest and fees that will accrue. However, I can offer a compromise - pay 50% of the debt, which is $75, now.

transcript.speaker: Vasu
transcript.content: I won't be able to pay fifty percent out of

transcript.speaker: Abhi
transcript.content: It seems like a payment plan of any kind may not be feasible at this time. I see that you're facing a lot of challenges. In that case, I'd like to propose that you provide a promise to pay the entire debt of $150 by a specific date, say, within the next 6 months.
